fields.name: North Carolina
fields.description: North Carolina is a state located in the southeastern United States, bordered by Virginia to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the east, South Carolina to the south, Georgia to the southwest, and Tennessee to the west. It is known for its diverse geography, including the Appalachian Mountains, the Piedmont region, and the coastal plain. The capital city is Raleigh, and the largest city is Charlotte. North Carolina has a rich history, being one of the original 13 colonies and known for its contributions to the American Revolution.

fields.name: Utah
fields.description: Utah is a landlocked state in the Mountain West subregion of the Western United States. It is one of the Four Corners states, sharing a border with Arizona, Colorado, and New Mexico. It also borders Wyoming to the northeast, Idaho to the north, and Nevada to the west. People from Utah are known as Utahns. Slightly over half of all Utahns are Mormons, the vast majority of whom are members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church), which has its world headquarters in Salt Lake City

fields.name: Wisconsin
fields.description: Nobody cares LOL

fields.name: Arizona
fields.description: Arizona is home to the Grand Canyon and is known for its desert climate, red rock landscapes, and Native American history.

fields.name: Arkansas
fields.description: Arkansas features mountains, forests, hot springs, and farmland, with a culture tied to the American South.

fields.name: California
fields.description: California is the most populous U.S. state, known for Hollywood, tech innovation, beaches, and national parks.

fields.name: Colorado
fields.description: Colorado is known for the Rocky Mountains, outdoor recreation, and vibrant cities like Denver and Boulder.

fields.name: Florida
fields.description: Florida is known for its beaches, warm climate, theme parks, and Latin American cultural influence.

fields.name: Georgia
fields.description: Georgia is known for its peaches, historic sites, and Atlantaâ€™s role as a major cultural hub.

fields.name: South Carolina
fields.description: South Carolina is a southeastern U.S. state known for coastal beaches, historic towns, and palmetto tree symbolism.

fields.name: Tennessee
fields.description: Tennessee is known for country music, the Great Smoky Mountains, and strong cultural ties to American music history.

fields.name: Kentucky
fields.description: Kentucky is known for horse racing, bourbon, bluegrass music, and the Appalachian Mountains.

fields.name: Virginia
fields.description: Virginia played a major role in early U.S. history and features coastal plains, mountains, and historical sites.

fields.name: West Virginia
fields.description: West Virginia is known for its rugged mountains, coal mining history, and outdoor recreation.

fields.name: Maryland
fields.description: Maryland borders Washington D.C. and is known for the Chesapeake Bay, seafood, and colonial history.

fields.name: Massachusetts
fields.description: Massachusetts is a historic New England state known for colonial history, universities, and technology hubs.

fields.name: Illinois
fields.description: Of the fifty U.S. states, Illinois has the fifth-largest gross domestic product (GDP), the sixth-largest population, and the 25th-most land area.

fields.name: Maine
fields.description: Maine features rugged coastlines, lighthouses, seafood, and vast northern forests.

fields.name: New York
fields.description: New York includes NYC, one of the world's major cultural and financial centers, along with forests and mountains.

fields.name: Pennsylvania
fields.description: Pennsylvania is known for Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, colonial history, and Amish communities.

fields.name: Texas
fields.description: Texas is the second-largest U.S. state, known for its diverse landscapes, energy industry, and strong identity.

fields.name: Nevada
fields.description: Nevada is known for Las Vegas, desert landscapes, mining history, and wide open spaces.

fields.name: Wyoming
fields.description: Wyoming is known for Yellowstone, the Tetons, cowboy culture, and wide plains.

fields.name: Oregon
fields.description: Oregon is known for forests, coastline, the Cascade Range, and outdoor-focused culture.

fields.name: New Mexico
fields.description: New Mexico blends Native American and Hispanic heritage and is known for deserts, adobe architecture, and art communities.
